Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that both China and Japan had reported new cases of COVID-19 in the days before and after the misleading posts were shared.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any reliable sources or data to support the assertion that China and Japan were COVID-19-free.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Philippines will be the third country to be "free" of COVID-19 without any evidence or basis for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the situation regarding COVID-19 can change rapidly, and it is not accurate to declare any country as completely free of the virus.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that China and Japan were already free of COVID-19, while in reality, both countries had reported new cases during that time.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not acknowledging the new cases reported in China and Japan during the mentioned timeframe, which undermines its accuracy.
